reasoning: Aggregate umbrella term covering inherited photoreceptor dystrophies and age-related macular degeneration. Prevalence estimate (~50 per 1,000 globally) accounts for: retinitis pigmentosa (~1-2 per 100k prevalence), inherited macular dystrophies (~100-500 per 100k), AMD (~1-3% of population / 10,000-30,000 per 100k age-dependent), and other retinal dystrophies. Heterogeneous conditions with vastly different etiologies, onset, and progression.
